message: I'm looking for a version of Linux that's easy to use that I can suggest to people who live on the web and don't want to vet viruses.
I like it.  The new Gnome 3 is clearly superior to Unity, to me anyway.

Some elements are still behind Ubuntu.  The "Add Remove programs" isn't as nice as the "Ubuntu software center" and there is no way to install themes that I have found.  There's a Gnome tweak tool that I still haven't found.  Searching in Fedora/Gnome for programs isn't easy.
I need to play with Fedora some more.  Today was the first time I've used it.  I'm back in Windows 7 now
I like fedora 15. Oddly enough its causing me to use my terminal more. I don't think that was their intention. :-) it is visually pleasing. I haven't used Unity.
